alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Roberts (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 21 at 1:27PM MST until February 21 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Marshall and Roberts Counties. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 9 PM CST this evening. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 9 PM this evening to 6 PM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
